newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian dollar eases, bonds edge up on data.
newsitem.headline: Australian dollar eases, bonds edge up on data.

text.p: The Australian dollar eased and debt futures firmed briefly after March and first quarter retail trade data proved slightly weaker than expectations.

The dollar was quoted at US$0.7837/42 compared with US$0.7840/50 just before the data releases. The June 10-year bond futures contract touched 92.140 against a pre-data 92.110. June bill futures also firmed, rising to 94.02 from 94.00.
March retail trade fell 0.3 percent compared with an expected flat outcome, while quarterly real retail trade rose 2.2 percent against an expected 2.4 percent rise.
